attributes.action: Relieve PM and cabinet of command in regard to pandemic response
attributes.additional_details: 100,000 British people have now been killed in a viral pandemic that has been exacerbated by government inaction, indecisive leadership, contradictory policy and political ineptitude. PM Johnson and his cabinet are out of their depth and floundering at public expense. Hesitation to close our borders in the early days of the pandemic to save face with the Chinese Communist Party, along with insufficient border testing and mandatory quarantining had a cost 100,000 lives, an intolerable figure.
attributes.background: I would see Parliament take a vote of no confidence against the PM and his cabinet. HMTQ should declare a state of national emergency, imposing martial law and ceding interim control of the pandemic response to a council scientists of holding relevant qualifications in epidemiology and medicine

rejection.details: We can't accept petitions about honours or appointments, which includes calling for Ministers or MPs to be sacked, resign, or to be subject to a recall vote or a vote of no confidence.
